Home → New in and suggestions → Music → New music for April 2015

New music for April 2015

No pier pressure by Brian Wilson

Pop legend Brian Wilson performs with a multitude of artists, including previous Beach Boys member Al Jardine, Blondie Chaplin, and actress Zooey Deschanel.

The magic whip by Blur

Return from a 12-year hiatus, described by Damon Albarn as a similar style to David Bowie’s mid 70s Berlin period.

Sound & color by Alabama Shakes

Soulful rock group follow up their successful debut album, Boys & Girls.

The day is my enemy by The Prodigy

First new album since 2009. Working with Sleaford Mods, this one is described by Liam Howlett as ‘angry’.

Undertow by Drenge

Raucous post-grunge fun from the Loveless brothers. Play loud.

Piece by Piece (Deluxe Version) by Kelly Clarkson (Freegal)

Seventh studio album by the American singer. Featuring the single Heartbeat Song and a collaboration with John Legend Run Run Run, the album debuted at #6 in the UK Albums Chart.

Lady Sings the Blues by Rebecca Ferguson (Freegal)

A Billie Holiday covers record which hears the X Factor singer take on classics like Summertime, Embraceable You and God Bless This Child.

Toto XIV by Toto (Freegal)

Classic pop act with over 38 years together and accolades to their names, Toto remains one of the top selling tour and recording acts in the world.
